Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "xamarin-android uses out-of-sync API generator from java.interop" (#1759) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
There is a big problem in xamarin-android API (Mono.Android) now. https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/1728 should have never been merged without merging https://github.com/xamarin/java.interop/pull/325 .

Next time API generation will be simply impossible.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`Build -> Archive` command hangs, "Please ensure that you are using a release configuration and that "Use Shared Mono Runtime" option unchecked."" (#1760) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set a project to release and build, and then Build -> Archive

<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
Create an archive
### Actual Behavior
It never completes.

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33150084/40775792-82015028-64fb-11e8-9d21-cfe709a4d25e.PNG)

I'm using release configuration and "Use Shared Mono Runtime" option is unchecked
```
    <BundleAssemblies>true</BundleAssemblies>
    <AotAssemblies>false</AotAssemblies>
```
This is my release configuration. I know this options are not available in the community verison of VS2017, but I can change it manually and reloade the project. It used to compile ok in April and earlier. I'm not sure if something changed in recent VS update.

### Version Information

Expected result:
Default browser (from OS settings) opens url.

Current method implementation for WPF:
public void OpenUriAction(Uri uri)
    {
    }

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[UWP,iOS] Enable screen readers to read non-interactive elements" (#2876) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

We expect screen readers to be able to read content by default. On iOS and UWP, this was not true for non-interactive elements such as Labels.

#### iOS
We create iOS views programmatically, in which case the `IsAccessibilityElement` value defaults to `false`. We expected it to default to `true`, as it states in the documentation, but this apparently is only the case when using storyboards. We are now explicitly setting `IsAccessibilityElement` to true for all controls.

#### UWP
This functionality was originally working, but it was thwarted by a change made later for UI testing. Reverting that change for now until we can find a better alternative.

### Bugs Fixed ###

- fixes #1946

### API Changes ###

None

### Behavioral Changes ###

- UWP UI Tests will probably fail
- Anyone explicitly setting `UIView.IsAccessibilityElement` to `false` in custom renderers should ensure they do so after `SetNativeControl` is called. Otherwise, it will be overridden to `true`.

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Keys from preceding merged dictionaries off an Application isnÂ´t immediately available in consequent dictionary" (#2920) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Application.MargeDictiion

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create the following files
```xaml
<!--File A.cs-->
<ResourceDictionary>
    <Color x:Key="A">Red</Color>
</ResourceDictionary>
<!--File B.cs-->
<ResourceDictionary>
    <Style TargetType="Label">
        <Setter Property="TextColor" Value="{StaticResource A}"/>
    </Style>
</ResourceDictionary>
<!--File App.cs-->
<App
    xmlns:local="..."
    ...>
    <App.MergedDictionaries>
        <local:A/>
        <local:B/>
    </App.MergedDictionaries>    
</App>
```
2. Execute the project

### Expected Behavior
The project should run without errors
### Actual Behavior
The exception below is raised
```
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664): System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.XamlParseException: Position 13:38. StaticResource not found for key A
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.CreateValuesVisitor.Visit (Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.ElementNode node, Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.INode parentNode) [0x0024b] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\CreateValuesVisitor.cs:92 
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.ElementNode.Accept (Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.IXamlNodeVisitor visitor, Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.INode parentNode) [0x000ab] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\XamlNode.cs:149 
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.ListNode.Accept (Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.IXamlNodeVisitor visitor, Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.INode parentNode) [0x00025] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\XamlNode.cs:227 
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.ElementNode.Accept (Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.IXamlNodeVisitor visitor, Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.INode parentNode) [0x00043] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\XamlNode.cs:143 
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.RootNode.Accept (Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.IXamlNodeVisitor visitor, Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.INode parentNode) [0x00043] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\XamlNode.cs:201 
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.XamlLoader.Visit (Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.RootNode rootnode, Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.HydrationContext visitorContext) [0x00054] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\XamlLoader.cs:138 
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.XamlLoader.Load (System.Object view, System.String xaml) [0x0004b] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\XamlLoader.cs:89 
06-03 20:14:21.905 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.XamlLoader.Load (System.Object view, System.Type callingType) [0x0002f] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\XamlLoader.cs:68 
06-03 20:14:21.906 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at Xamarin.Forms.Xaml.Extensions.LoadFromXaml[TXaml] (TXaml view, System.Type callingType) [0x00000] in D:\agent_work\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Xaml\ViewExtensions.cs:36 
06-03 20:14:21.906 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at ServiceApp.App.InitializeComponent () [0x00001] in C:\ServiceApp\ServiceApp\obj\Debug\ServiceApp.obj.Debug.App.xaml.g.cs:20 
06-03 20:14:21.906 I/MonoDroid(23664):   at ServiceApp.App..ctor () [0x00008] in C:\ServiceApp\ServiceApp\App.xaml.cs:22 
```
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: All
  - iOS:  11.10.1.177 (7e782c1)
  - Android: 8.3.0.19 (HEAD/342b2ce96)
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms 2.5.0.280555

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Why is Stepper Up button hardcoded to 10 pixels height on Android?" (#2919) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
StepperRenderer for Android shows:

`_upButton.SetHeight((int)Context.ToPixels(10.0));`

Why is this?  It causes the _downButton to be taller than the _upButton.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Stepper alternate constructor NOT calling this() to initialize _platformConfigurationRegistry" (#2918) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
If you look at Slider, it has 2 constructors, the default with no arguments and an alternate with min, max, and value.  The default constructor initializes _platformConfigurationRegistry and the alternate constructor extends the default with ": this()".  This way the alternate constructor will still initialize the _platformConfigurationRegistry.

Stepper is NOT doing this.  The alternate constructor does NOT call this() so the _platformConfigurationRegistry is NOT being initialized so any app using the alternate constructor will crash with NPE.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Core] Report binding failures" (#2911) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Opened pull request "[foundation] Override Message property in NSErrorException. Fixes #4133" (#4176) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
The default `Message` property is not every helpful. Better information
is available inside the `Error` property but it's not general (nor cross
platform) when dealing with exception.

Include unit tests (on an existing test checking NSError values)

https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/4133

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Your mono runtime and class libraries are out of sync message while building unittest projects with XI master" (#4174) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update System with Xamarin.iOS project, XI version: 11.11.0.331 (master: 238eb94c) 
2. Build and Run any unit test on device.

### Expected Behavior
Build Log should not contain any out of sync messages.

### Actual Behavior
"Your mono runtime and class libraries are out of sync" message is  present in build logs.

### Environment

```
Operating System: Mac OS X 10.13.4
Bot Name: XQA-XI-Sierra-6
Mono version: 5.14.0.106 (820bff26b3b)  (2018-05-25 17:29:19 -04:00)
XA version: 8.3.99.19 (HEAD/09df99bdc) 
XI version: 11.11.0.331 (master: 238eb94c) 
XM version: 4.5.0.331 (master: 238eb94c)  (2018-05-25 07:47:00 -04:00)
XVS version: 
XS version: 7.6.0.971 (e936c76)  (2018-05-28 12:49:41 -04:00)
```

### Build Logs

http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-c8b3a0e9db67473ebe1ff9df22e7c44d.txt, with mono 5.14
http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-641ce6bd5c0545618ad5b7f981fcbbdf.txt with mono 5.12

### Example Project (If Possible)

Any unit test project in xamarin-macios/tests/ folder. 

## Additional Info:
This is not a new issue in master. It was happening for quite sometime. I confirmed that QA tests are checking out the correct external/mono and build logs are not giving false results, also checked manually. This issue is occurring in bots with either mono 5.14 or 5.12 installed.
